- (1,2) has no apple.
- (0,3) has no apple.
- (2,3) has no apple.

- From (2,3): Up to (2,4) (empty), Down to (2,2) (empty), Left to (1,3) (body), Right to (3,3) (empty). Nearest apple is (3,4) (one up and one right), or (2,8) (far up).

Right now, none of the moves gets me to an apple in one step. But moving right or up gives me more open space for maneuvering, while moving left puts me closer to the wall.

Additionally, the opponent is at (0,0). If I go to (0,3), I'm not directly threatening or threatened, but if the opponent moves up, they could try to intercept me.

A good strategy is to keep my options open and head toward clusters of apples. The apples at (3,4), (5,1), (6,6), (8,9), etc., are the closest clusters.

Between UP and RIGHT, RIGHT gets me closer to the cluster near (3,4), (6,6), (8,7), etc.

Therefore, I will choose RIGHT as my move.

Plan for the next few turns: Move right to (2,3), then continue toward the cluster of apples near the upper right, avoiding the left edge and keeping space to maneuver. Watch opponent's movements and avoid head-on collisions or getting boxed in.
